lead_paragraph: Efforts to require more transparency from private equity firms have hit a wall, even as investors like public pension funds realize diminishing returns.

headline.print_headline: Keeping Private Equity Shrouded in Shadows
headline.main: Private Equity Funds Balk at Disclosure, and Public Risk Grows

snippet: Efforts to require more transparency from private equity firms have hit a wall, even as investors like public pension funds realize diminishing returns....
abstract: Gretchen Morgenson Fair Game column urges more transparency of private equity firms--investment sector utilized by most public pension funds and university endowments--following 2015 studies that show investors are taking on more risk without any additional benefit; notes some lawmakers are trying to roll back regulations following series of SEC enforcement actions against private equity firms.
